titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: , Rector of S. George's, Handsworth, offering him nomination to Holy Trinity, Stockton.
This fatuous lecture for the Castle Fund, which I am pledged to give at Harrogate on Wednesday evening haunts me. It is these "side–shows" which take up time, & ruin one's real work.
The Bishop of Jarrow came to see me, & stayed to discuss various matters until nearly 8 p.m.
The news about the King's illness this morning is grave, & it is evident that we must contemplate the contingency of a fatal termination. This would be a calamity indeed
Tomorrow the great pageant of the Archbishop's enthronement is to take place in Canterbury Cathedral. Will it coincide with the passing of George V?
